thread.title: Dell pays $67bn for EMC in biggest ever tech takeover
thread.title_full: Dell pays $67bn for EMC in biggest ever tech takeover

title: Dell pays $67bn for EMC in biggest ever tech takeover
text:
Login 
He is often described as an introvert — an odd description for someone who has splashed out $91 billion in two years (Nic Fildes writes). Perhaps the reason for Michael Dell’s moniker is because his two mega-deals have taken Dell Computers and now EMC off the public markets and have played to his desire to keep his private life, well, private. Mr Dell, 50, showd a flair for business early on, when he sold computers he had made in his student dorm. He dropped out of univer-sity and came up with a plan to sell directly to customers. It worked and by 2001 Dell was the largest PC maker in the world. Mr Dell stepped down as chief executive in 2004 to become chairman, but returned to his former role in 2007 at the request of the board. The takeover of EMC is his latest bid to stay relevant. Worth near $20 billion, Mr Dell is known to have said "celebrate for a nano-second, then move on" — so don’t expect too many champagne corks to pop tonight. Behind the story: 
Michael Dell and Silver Lake, the private equity company, are in talks to buy EMC, a former stock market darling... Published at October 9 2015 Sponsored Editorial
